title: REPORT: D. Jackson's L.A. home invaded, cops suspect gang involvement
text:

Jackson's L.A. home invaded, cops suspect gang involvement According to a TMZ report, Redskins WR DeSean Jackson's Los Angeles home was victim of a violent invasion on October 21. Post to Facebook REPORT: D. Jackson's L.A. home invaded, cops suspect gang involvement According to a TMZ report, Redskins WR DeSean Jackson's Los Angeles home was victim of a violent invasion on October 21.  //on.wusa9.com/1LSeCud   REPORT: D. Jackson's L.A. home invaded, cops suspect gang involvement WUSA 9 Staff, WUSA 1:06 p.m. EDT October 23, 2015 Sep 3, 2015; Landover, MD, USA; Washington Redskins wide receiver DeSean Jackson (11) looks on prior to the game against the Jacksonville Jaguars at FedEx Field. The Jaguars won 17-16. Mandatory Credit: Amber Searls-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Amber Searls, Amber Searls-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET   
LOS ANGELES (WUSA9) -- According to a TMZ report , Redskins star wide receiver DeSean Jackson's Los Angeles home was victim of a "violent home invasion" on Wednesday, October 21. 
According to the report, Jackson's Tarzana, California home was swarmed by four or five armed gunmen on Wednesday morning . There were roughly six people inside of Jackson's home at the time of the invasion (Jackson was not present). One of the civilians inside Jackson's house was reportedly "pistol whipped", sustaining minor injuries. 
TMZ Report: DeSean Jackson: Home Invasion, Victims Attacked ... Cops Suspect Gang Involvement 
The people inside of Jackson's home eventually fought off the gunmen, who then fled the scene. According to the report, investigators believe the gunmen "had been in the home before." The report goes on to say that the armed intruders knew "exactly where" Jackson's security cameras were placed. 
TMZ's "law enforcement sources" claim that they have leads on as to who the suspects are and also believe the incident was "gang related." 
Jackson has been questioned in the past as to whether or not he has gang affiliations . Jackson has repeatedly denied any sort of gang involvement, but does admit to having friends in gangs. 
No further information has been released in regards to the invasion.
